Reviews.Title: “Problems with Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Kavena
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this Motel 6 two or three times before and liked it quite a bit so I was extremely disappointed this time. The first room I was given had an unresponsive air conditioning unit, a bathtub that didn't drain well, and a bed without a blanket. At 3 a.m. I went down to the front desk to ask for a blanket and was told there were none left. So up I went to freeze for several hours underneath a thin bedspread in a fairly stuffy room. The bed was hard - felt like I was sleeping on the floor. I hated the "upgrade" with diner-like seats near the bed, the closet behind the TV screen, etc. The next day I was allowed to transfer to another room and was given two blankets so at least they tried to improve the situation. The second room had the same hard bed, the blankets were so thin they didn't keep me warm at night, and in this room there was almost no water pressure for the shower/bathroom sink. I was also a bit surprised that a small box of tissues wasn't provided - perhaps they should advertise that they provide a tiny bar of soap and that's it. So I'm not inclined to stay at this Motel 6 again. In their favor the area felt safe enough and the staff was pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Tzinti
Reviews.Content: I had the disabled room, which meant an enormous bathroom. Although in terms of attractivenenss the bathroom left a bit to be desired, it was very clean.On the second night I stayed I had a problem with the tv - the fix-it person was there literally as soon as I had put the phone down to report the problem, and he fixed it immediately. All of the staff were extremely helpful. The location was fantastic, like maybe 7 mins. walk to the Gaslamp although there's also a bus stop right outside. There was some noise from other guests once or twice, but nothing major at all. Mostly the place was very quiet. If I had a bigger budget I would stay at a swankier place, but I didn't and what I did get was value for money here. There are street people everywhere in San Diego, including about a block away from the hotel, but I never at any time felt any kind of threat from anyuone, exactly the opposite. I live in Mexico and felt extremely safe at all times in SD. Wolud come back here.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: OnlyHighways
Reviews.Content: In addition to being in a great location at a great price, this is not your run-of-the-mill Motel 6. It started at the lobby – relatively sleek and with a view of an outdoor plaza with nice tropical plants. The hallways were newly carpeted. The real shocker was the rooms though – very modern décor and simple with a European or Asian feel. Although small, I found the room soothing and pleasant, and the bed comfortable. They also had plenty of parking (although getting into some of the spots was tight). On the downside, the shower was low (I’m tall) and had poor water pressure. The bathroom door was awkwardly placed, and had to be kept closed to enable passing through the room. The front desk staff was generally civil but there was sometimes an undercurrent of surliness. The most annoying event was how hot our room would be by the time we returned in the evening, the vents seemed to be blowing hot air although the heat wasn’t on. The maid did seem to turn up the AC pretty high (75 or 80) but that was about the outside temperature and the room felt a lot hotter than that. We’d have to crank the AC down to 60 and open windows to air it out. Overall, this motel is well worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, but much to be desired in cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: NavyShooter
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel, and while the location is handy, the rooms are both dated, and not well cleaned. To go into detail, the piece of gum left on a shelf and the rather mildew encrusted shower head left me somewhat concerned about the rest if the room. The good news, the girl at the front desk was very pleasant, and the price was affordable. I would not chose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We like it, but know what your are booking”
Reviews.Author: CAAdams
Reviews.Content: We returned for another visit in February. (last visited in 2008) They have remodeled and we really liked the new decor. It is clean and simple and very European. I understand why some call it spartan and not homey, but we actually thought it was great. The staff was wonderful and we had a great stay. We could walk to everything and yet it was convenient to I-5 when we wanted to go farther afield. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Saved The Day - Don't Bring A Child!”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: Please note - the overall rating I have given for the property reflects the stupidity of the Motel 6 website - not the actual quality of the hotel, room or staff. It's cheap, cheerful and good value for money if there's one or two of you - just don't bring a kid! The dumb Motel 6 website allows you to cheerfully book a child in a motel that doesn't have room for them! At no stage were we warned that the property could not accommodate children in any way, shape or form. Staff didn't even have a rollaway bed for emergencies. We were told that it 'happens a lot'. Morons. Whilst I'm grateful that the member of staff helped us move the next night to the other Motel 6 across town (after asking her to call and move us), it was still a totally unnecessary stressful situation to be placed in. This should not have happened. This is basic for a hotel website. It cost us time, money, inconvenience with moving luggage and worry. We were lucky as they had one room left. Had we left it until the morning to book, I think we would have been stuffed. Three of us crammed into a bed for the night, because we were too tired to care after a long drive. On the positive side, the room was very clean, fast (chargeable) Wifi, large range of TV channels but a little cramped. Our room was on the top floor which was away from the noise. Parking is right next door (free with a permit) and you can get a great takeaway pizza from the restaurant behind the motel and water/milk from the nearby petrol station. Buyer beware if you have small ones with you and use the Motel 6 website to book.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a hike to the gaslight district and tiny room but OK.”
Reviews.Author: Nan N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 for two nights. We had one of our dogs with us so we needed a place that allowed pets. The hotel was in good repair and the parking while not secure was well lit. The room was really really small, tiny in fact.There was barely enough space to open a suitcase but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel was billed as being right next to the gaslight district but in fact it was quite a hike over to the gaslight district and the neighbourhood we walked through to get there wasn't sketchy or anything but it was really deserted and dark. There were no people around at all which kind of made me wonder why. The front desk people were efficient, our reservation with deposit was all in order and one of the ladies on the front desk had a doggie treat for our dog which was really nice. The hotel was OK but we probably wouldn't stay here again unless we are traveling with one of our dogs again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: DoriumLux
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel to stay in a stich while traveling for business. I wasnt getting along with the person who was hosting me, and just wanted to get away. I was so desperate, I was willing to stay at Motel 6. However, when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised! Not only was the room clean, it was modern looking! Bright colors, clean lines, flat screen TV, clean bathroom, and granite countertops for $50 a night in a beach town? WOW. I was pretty excited, and very comfortable. I am single female and I also felt safe. The hotel staff was great. It's not luxurious by any means, but the price was luxurious! The free parking was nice. Recommendations? Bring your own comfortable pillow, and bring your own shampoo. If I ever come to San Diego for pleasure, I will stay here again. I'd rather save on a hotel, and splurge on the important stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: Helouise
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night close to the airport. The reception staff were really helpful and friendly and the room was clean. unfortunately the air conditioning had been left on and the room was freezing so we had to sleep in layers of clothes until the room warmed up so sleep quality was poor. also the noise from the airconditioning unit was very intrusive even though it was not switched on. The motel is situated in a good location of the city in walking distance to the gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “"Very good"...for a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: wordofthewise
Reviews.Content: I am not one to normally stay at a Motel 6 by any means. But this one was recently redone and we were on a budget. Rooms were clean and pretty comfy. Sort of like a private room in a hostel. The pillows were pretty uncomfortable and bring your own shampoo! They only supply soap. Great location, felt safe walking at night and could get to all the major attractions by walking or taking public transit. Far from luxurious, but the rooms were clean and was a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is the Best Budget Option in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: LBPurnell
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel locally, the Motel 6 is always our default motel to stay at. It's cheap and has the basics. Most locations are outdated with a late 70's early 80's feel. However, this location is different. First, you cannot beat the location. It's walking distance to Gaslamp (or a short cab ride). For the price you pay, which is more than a typical Motel 6, it's a good deal. It's clean and the front desk is always friendly and accommodating. The rooms have all be renovated and have an IKEA feel to them, but that's what makes it unique. All the rooms have flat screen TV's with cable. The rooms are a bit small, but that's what you get when you stay in a downtown area. The beds were very comfortable. As with any Motel 6, they have complimentary coffee in the morning, which you could probably skip, as it's not that great.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JocelynSoler
Reviews.Content: we found this place excellent!.. was very clean!, the photos show exactly how the room is it... everything it´s completely new!.. it has a plasma tv, the bathroom it´s nice!... also the staff it´s very friendly... they all the time tried to give us information about the city! i want to come back to this place!.. it´s very nice!... it´s in the second avenue, so you can walk to the center, it takes like 15 minutes, near to everything... 10 min to little italy, 20 min by car to the premium outlets... it´s very safe at night... we didn´t have any problem at all... the only thing it´s that they don´t have breakfast includes.. but they put coffee in the morning..

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Motel 6 style”
Reviews.Author: HernanCortez
Reviews.Content: Hi If you know the Motel 6 brand, then you know what to expect. If you don't know the Motel 6 brand, then you may need to adjust your expectations. Compare what you pay at Motel 6, with what you'd have paid at the Hilton, Mariott etc. For what I paid at Motel 6, it was great value. The location is a little bit out of the centre downtown, but an easy walk. You can be in the Gaslamp area in 7-10 minutes. Depending on which route you walk, you do walk by the sad reality of San Diego's homeless problem, however there are no issues with people hassling you (in my experience). I stayed for 7 nights. The room was functional, clean and the staff helpful and friendly. The free car parking was a definite advantage. I've seen some comments about cleanliness, this is dependant upon the individual staff member (and the floor manager). My room was cleaned well. Not much around the hotel, however there is a restaurant and liquor store/deli only 1-2 minutes walk away. For what I paid, it was very good value. It won't be for everyone, especially those with certain expectations, however for a business traveller like me who has an eye on costs, then it was the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great time”
Reviews.Author: Howellsey
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is a Motel 6 not a Radisson or Hilton, so some perspective, but we loved it here. The staff have been friendly and helpful, providing tourist information and answering any questions with humour and politeness. Our room was immaculate, cleaned every day and the bed was comfy, couldn't ask for anymore. The location is great, equi-distant from Little Italy and the Gaslamp and an easy walk for all but the laziest guest. Free parking, free coffee and a minute of the interstate. Go Motel 6 !!

Reviews.Title: “Was Alright - Quite, But Basic”
Reviews.Author: Steve-And-Barbara
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Super 8 (see other review) this hotel is probably not worth what we paid. The room was small, very clinical ie no carpet. TV was ok, no free Wifi and parking could potentially be impossible - they have about 30 spaces for 50 rooms, although it was free. Bed was a bit smaller than what we had got used to in the other hotels we've stayed in in the states. Location was good, the Westfields mall was only a 5 minute walk, and the habour probably 10 mins. Lady on reception was very nice though, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: pdhuey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to book at Motel 6 to save a little money. We will never do so again! I left my cell phone turned on and sitting on the bedside table for several hours as we visited the sites. When we came back, housekeeping had cleaned the room and the phone was gone. When I called my number I found that the phone had been turned off. The maid stole my phone. The only response from the front desk was, "Wow. That sucks." Do yourself a favor and avoid this motel! I also prepaid for WIFI, but the only way I was able to use it was by taking my laptop to the lobby since the room we were in could not get a signal. One more thing: When housekeeping brought new towels, we found hair on them.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but downtown is abit sketchy”
Reviews.Author: Nator86
Reviews.Content: Location is about 10 minute walk to Gaslamp district. However, just south of the motel there is a noticeable amount of homeless people which is typical to most downtown's of major cities. Overall, it was an okay hotel, staff were friendly. Wifi was not free which sucks, however a big plus is the free parking. Room was small and a bit cramped but okay if your only staying a night or two. Overall look of the remodeled rooms were good. Another good thing about this place is that it has laundry facilities on the premise which is handy for those on longer trips and need cleaning. Definately worth staying if you want to be downtown and have access to free parking.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: joankoh
Reviews.Content: The motel is located in a good location. We arrived in San Diego via Amtrak and walked for around twenty minutes before reaching. It's near the seaport area (where the USS midway aircraft museum is) & Horton plaza (shopping district). Parking is free too if you drive. The staff gave us a map of places to go and was helpful when addressing our queries. The room is pretty basic but clean. We did laundry there too and washing powder was provided at $1. My only complain is that we couldn't get the Wifi up and the guy who was in charge of looking into this failed to turn up in our room as promised. Not too sure if this was due to our room being located at the far end of the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent motel, very central, clean and tidy, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mhcd_2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent motel, very clean and tidy and central. Safe area. Everything in downtown San Diego is more or less in walking distance. For people who prefer to walk its not even that far away from everything, inc the Zoo, maybe 20mins max... Reception staff were really friendly. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty but good location”
Reviews.Author: Madster02
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the bare minimum. They provide a bar of soap and towels in the bathroom and that's really about all you get besides a bed and T.V. The room looked so dirty I peeled back the comforter to lay on the bed and walked around the room in my shoes because the floor had not been cleaned. The light switches had caked on dirt and seemingly food bits from previous guests. There was only one outlet that I could find, near the bed. The elevator takes at least 3 minutes to get to your floor, so plan accordingly if you're in a big rush. It's a central location, but don't stay if you like a super clean room. Oh, and bring your own shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: sunnydays007
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated and excellent price for the location. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. It's within walking distance of Little Italy, Gas Lamp district and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: tahkhengsoon
Reviews.Content: clean room. comfortable bed. WiFi connection is great. I am happy I chose to stay here for one week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price-performance proposition”
Reviews.Author: tgurgel
Reviews.Content: That was a very nice surprise.. Actually it was the first time I've stayed at a Motel 6 and the experience with this one was over my expectations. The location was good, a 10-minute walk from Gaslamp Quarter and the downtown. The room was small but very functional. Clean and comfortable. Wireless internet working very well. I stayed in a corner room, which made it even more brighter. I definitely recommend..... The price was fair enough also.

Reviews.Title: “small budget bargain basic in great location with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGoMore
Reviews.Content: tiny room, twin beds, close to airport, walk to cruise ship, shopping, restaurants. internet $ 3 / hr, phone, tv

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Comfy.”
Reviews.Author: animac55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Motel 6 locations and can rate most all of them very high even before they remodeled a large majority of their locatiions. I have stayed at this location each time I come to San Diego. Why spend more money when you are not going to find a better value in lodging. It is safe, very attractive, staff is very accomodating, rooms are comfy and at such a cash-saving value, you can keep your money in your pocket for the sites, you can't pay for better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: pgully3
Reviews.Content: Room's are nice, and feature modern decor, but are pretty small. Hotel staff was great. Wifi was $3 per day. Parking was free. Located a few blocks from the Gaslamp District (15-20 min. walk, 3-5 min. drive). At around $60-$70 per night, it's a great value, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “On a budget....Then come on down”
Reviews.Author: Aplaza
Reviews.Content: I have to say reading these reviews of the hotel some are misrepresented. The location is just outside the tourist area of Gas Lamp Quarter, one of the most famous places in San Diego. So without breaking the bank this is an ideal location, and only 5-6 blocks away. 10 blocks to Petco Park for the ball fans. The rooms were small, updated and a modern twist, no more then 2 people per room, its a funcitional room, nothing special, note they do not supply shampoo or anything. Parking is tight, but with two lots there is always a space available, i drove around during my stay and never missed a spot. The area is on the outside of a tourist zone, and like more american cities that have hot spots the outsides are sometimes not as nice, during the day there was nothing wrong, and i did walk at night, but you have to have common sense and keep your witts and you'll be fine. The hotel staff was great, Kurt the manager was good on his promise of a quite, clean room, if you have any problems talk to him. He's more then generous. All in all its well worth the price, as you are walking distance from anything, food, night life, warf, battleships. Warning: There is limited to zero internet ( that you have to purchase for 2.99 for 24hrs) unless your room has the router.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff, excellent location for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: samikwok
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in August, managed to find hotel very easily from the airport, its right off the I-5 so easy enough to find. Parking was fairly simple, they have 2 car parks, one that is behind the hotel and one on the side. Side car park was a bit smaller and sometimes difficult to park in but back car park was fine and easy to use as well. Check in went smoothly, Abby was extremely helpful throughout our entire stay, providing us with a map, idea of where to go and eat and also a cooler box which we returned after our stay. Room was fine, very comfortable, maid service every day, only complaints are sometimes floors weren't always clean and even though we found wifi to only be $2.99 per day, we had problems with connectivity as the signal was quite weak! Overall, its in a really good location and its 15 mins walk to Gaslamp district, we had a car for the trip so found it a great location for our price.

Reviews.Title: “I was very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: rsollars
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable room. I stayed one night and enjoyed it very much after a day at Sea World. The flooring and bathroom were brand new. The bed was comfortable. The TV reception great. The noise level fine (Tuesday night). The service was good and I was given directions to local restaurants where I wanted to eat by the staff. My only complaint was that the room seemed a bit small to me which would not make a place I would want to room for a whole week.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: nancyang03
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience w/ Motel 6, and it was a pleasant one. The rooms were very clean, simply and modern. Reminded me of futuristic rooms from a movie or something. No bells and whistles in room, but blow dryers, irons and extra amenities were available upon request. Staff members were nice and helpful. Gaslamp and the cruise harbors were walking distance (about 15 mins), but we were running a little late (our own faults), so we took a cab instead. Outside the hotel was quiet. Keys/cards are required to enter through back parking lot, so there was some sense of safety there. I'd def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean stylish hotel with a lot of beggars outside”
Reviews.Author: Hdoggydogg
Reviews.Content: Very cool interior, clean, safe inside but I didnt like all the drugaddicts/beggars/bums living on a parkinglot just outside the hotel. They didnt do me anything, but they made me feel unsafe and I didnt go home by myself at night. The location is very close (6min walk) to Broadway and a maybe 12 min to Gaslamp. Not a lot of good eatingplaces or any shops just outside the hotel, so be prepared to have to walk to Broadway to eat your breakfast. My room were really cool with Scandinavian/IKEA style, a fairly large flatscreen tv and a very clean and inviting feeling. My room didnt face the street, so it was very quiet. But overall- a very good place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, nice place”
Reviews.Author: mattpet
Reviews.Content: My first Motel 6 experience, and it was a very good one. Hotel has ample parking, is located in a nice area, and is within walking distance of the ocean. Plenty of food nearby. Room was clean but a little small. You can only have one bed per room here. Laundry facilities were good, staff was helpful. You have to purchase the wireless internet, which is a minus.

Reviews.Title: “Do not come here with more than 2 people!!”
Reviews.Author: fastcat1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely deceptive. I booked a room for myself and three teenagers and 2 dogs. I wrote on the reservation that I had pets and that I needed a room for 4 adults. When we arrived we were told that the room had only one queen bed. Upon seeing the room it was obvious that it was meant for no more than 2 people. It's tiny! I was forced to buy a second room so ended up paying double. For that amount of money believe me you can stay at a much nicer hotel in San Diego. For example, The Marriott Residence Inn right down the street has better rooms, offers breakfast and a light dinner, and has a pool too. Back to motel six; they have done some renovations but the room is so small and cramped that even with 2 in it you'll feel claustrophobic. The light in the bathroom flickers constantly, and bring your own pillow. Coffee in the morning is disgusting and only had powered creamer...yuck! Theres are hard as rocks. Also the view from the room looks directly into a room about 4 feet away. Perfect for stalkers! I highly recommend that you don't stay here. I was told by the manager that the fire department allows them to put 4 people in these rooms? If they do they are creating a fire trap. The one redeeming quality was the nice person who worked at the desk when we checked in. She was sympathetic and said they'vew had this complaint many many times.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, cheap as anything...”
Reviews.Author: LDN_2009
Reviews.Content: The Motel 6 San Diego Downtown is close to everything. It sits just off an exit of the I-5, is five minutes in the car from the airport, Balboa Park and the Old Town and a mere ten minutes on foot from the Gaslamp Quarter. The sight of homeless all around was immediately worrying until you realise they are everywhere. San Diego really does have a problem. But they don't beg and rarely even look up so we quickly relaxed. The room was modern, basic and comfortable, the front desk was helpful with information, taxi bookings and alarm calls and there's ample parking. This close to everywhere you want to go, being able to walk to and back from the bustling Gaslamp Quarter, and with rates this cheap I can't think of anywhere I'd rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, decent no-frills room in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mua312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Motel 6 both before and after our cruise (which left from San Diego). We picked it primarily based on location, costs, and other decent reviews, and it was exactly as we expected. Keep in mind that this is a motel, and a fairly no-frills on at that. Nevertheless, it was a safe, clean, and decent place to sleep for a good price (paid between $55-70 based on the night). Main complaints are that the bath towels are quite skimpy, pillows fairly flat (ask front desk for an extra pillow) and there was no shampoo. Front desk has hairdryers upon request - quite useful! The bed on our first stay was quite good; the bed on the second stay left much to be desired - sagging in the middle and left much to be desired. Our room on the second stay was quite a bit bigger but located next to the stairwell - as a result, we heard people going up and down stairs all evening. Both of us our good sleepers, but if you are not, I'd recommend asking for a room NOT near the stairs, and one that faces the courtyard as opposed to the street. Front desk staff was helpful, depending on who was there. The bus and trolley stops were within 5 minutes walking distance, and made transportation quite easy. The Gaslamp district is only a bit farther away. We took the 992 bus to the airport - $2.50 as opposed to the $10-15 taxi fare. In addition, we bought day passes for public transportation to visit the zoo, Balboa Park, and La Jolla. All in all, a good place to stay if you're on a budget and looking to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “great,clean,cheap and 5 mins from it all”
Reviews.Author: keithrevenge
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for 2 nights in january.The rooms are newly remodeled and very clean.Not huge rooms but perfect for what we wanted(to sleep).The gaslamp quarter is only 5 mins walk and there,s free car parking.All this for $55 per night.If your on a budget and want to be very close to the nightlife then this is the spot for you.Next time im over from ireland ill gladely stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great price and good location”
Reviews.Author: KatyerFin
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty great as it is a walking distance to the Gaslamp. Hotel rooms were clean and quite new but the shower wasn't the best possible. Free parking but wi-fi is chargeable and at first it didn't work (they warned us that they had some problems with the connection). I didn't like the fact that the cleaners came to your room because there wasn't a sign you could hang in to your door. It is a ok stay for few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not far from downtown. Need to fix the showers though...”
Reviews.Author: bearpackers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on top floor. Room size is decent with queen bed. TV good with lots of channels. Location only 5 mins walk from horton plaza. Weird showers with low pressure. Only way to get higher pressure is to increase the temp to really hot. Will be back though.

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem”
Reviews.Author: chifanba
Reviews.Content: Spotless, newly and stylishly renovated small room. Fine location. Amazingly low price, excellent value for money. Have stayed twice in last year and will stay again. If arriving by car during a workday, be prepared to be flexible. The hotel has 2 lots with free guest parking but these are also available for public parking during the day, in a neighborhood where parking is tight. I arrived mid-day on a workday and there were no spaces avaiable, but tried again after 1/2 hour in the hotel's "3 minute" space and luckily found one space. I would guess this problem happens often but front desk did not seem to have a "Plan B" for this ("we only have the 2 lots").

Reviews.Title: “Excellant experience no drama!”
Reviews.Author: carterblack
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room with nice LCD tv and timely maid service. The thing I would change is the soap would prefer body wash but, otherwise a great value motel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: CATravelerSanDiego
Reviews.Content: To avoid generally expensive hotel rates in San Diego, the downtown Motel 6 is a good choice for those on a budget. The whole hotel was recently renovated, and looks great. Good bed, flat screen TV, excellent lighting, lots of electrical outlets, double-pane windows to keep out street noise and WiFi ($2.99 a day). I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeannetteMichigan
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location. Close to Gas Lamp district, Little Italy, the trolley, and San Diego Harbor. Clean, fresh, modern rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Free parking. And all at a great price. When you are in San Diego you don't stay in your room anyway, there is so much to do. So it won't matter if the room is a little on the small side. We loved it and stayed 4 days even though we had originally only reserved for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: LeneNorway
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at Motel 6 in San Simeon in 2008 we were looking forward to a spacious and quiet room. That was definetely not the case in San Diego. The room was so small that one could hardly think in there, we practicly had to leave the room to be able to change our minds, as we say in Norwegian. It was also quite noisy there. Ok for one night, and cheap, but not worth staying in for two nights when you are at holiday enjoying yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price, and free parking were the best features”
Reviews.Author: kellz14
Reviews.Content: Overall the place was very clean and well maintained. It is in walking distance to the gaslamp so this was a huge plus, since we didn't have to pay for parking at the gaslamp. This has got to be one of the only hotels in downtown that give you free parking. The rooms were clean, but the modern decor coupled with the small size made it feel more like a cell than a hotel room. I would only recommend this if you really want to stick to a budget since it is very clean a well maintained, but very very no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Budget GEM”
Reviews.Author: Titusfuc
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy compact room with single queensize bed, with very helpful staff. We satyed here for two days the experience was pleasant with free parking next to the hotel. It is located a few minutes walk from the gas lamps or italian districts and I could not have found a better location. When we arrived it was fully booked so booking is probably wise.

Reviews.Title: “fair enough place if you need to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: geppe1970
Reviews.Content: perfect for downtown San Diego. one of the best motel 6 I have been to. There's a laundry near the reception. Quite useful! Go there if you want to stay downtown

Reviews.Title: “Don't need fancy, just down home basics!”
Reviews.Author: Stan_D_Pipe
Reviews.Content: Three stays over a five week period for business. All I needed was a room to clean-up in, the internet and a place to sleep. I found that the Downtown Motel 6 not only provided the basics I needed, but had free parking (for an oversize truck) and was located within easy walking distance of downtown San Diego. Kurt Thomas and his staff were more than willing to assist with my special request. Thanks Kurt, and better luck with the Padres next season!

Reviews.Title: “When in San Diego no need to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: mscud1
Reviews.Content: The price was good, and the room was clean. The BIG problem I had was it was a smoking room when I requested a non-smoking room. They didn't have any other rooms to switch me to so all my belongings wreeked of smoke after my stay. You would think the location would be good being "downtown San Diego", but there is absolutely nothing worth while seeing in this drab dirty city. If I knew better I would have stayed by the beaches. SD is a beach town. The city is forgetable. The hotel is also in a creepy location. I feel safer walking in my own city of NY. Skip downtown and stay beachside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but they don't have 2 queen beds room”
Reviews.Author: roadtripbcnbr09
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for 4 adults for just one night through the motel 6 web page. Since at the others Motel 6 they have 2 queen beds rooms, we didn't notice that one does NOT have 2 queen bed rooms. Furthermore the web page allows you to make the reservation for 4 people in a room with just one queen bed... Fortunately the hotel wasn't sold out, so we could manage to have 2 rooms. I couldn't imagine looking for another hotel late in the night after driving for hours... The good news are the hotel is completely refurbished and nice. The rooms are modern, and the staff is really nice and friendly. The parking is free, and a short walking distance from Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: MXPRTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really cute. Updated and very clean. They are small but who cares!! For less than 100 bucks! Well worth it. The staff was super nice. No free breakfast but they had free coffee. When I return to San Diego, this is where I am staying!! Oh, You might want to bring a pillow. They are flat and there are no extras in the room.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Pleasantly Surprised - Single Female and Traveled Alone!”
Reviews.Author: KATaylor1
Reviews.Content: I visited San Diego for my birthday in May for six days and had a very pleasurable experience! The rooms have all be overhauled and now include platform beds, flat screen televisions and a really cute seating area. Yes, the rooms are small"ish" but I was more than comfortable and enjoyed my stay very much and would definitely go again. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and it's in a great location and the price is right! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days”
Reviews.Author: Ca0516
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in the city for a decent price. This Motel 6 was perfect! The rooms were clean, it was a nice walk to the harbor, resturants, and the trolley. We stayed for 5 nights and each night walked the short distance to the Gaslamp District for dinner and to go out at night. The small deli next door made breakfast/lunch a quick, easy, cheap and satisfying meal. The staff was very friendly and helpful, providing a highlighted map showing the main streets leading to different sights or attrractions. Parking was great all the time too. Being a young couple, this hotel was right in our budget and provided us with a comfortable, safe and convient place to stay. We are going back in October and staying their for another 5 nights and after our first great experience there is no need to spend more money at a hotel that offeres the same ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Reasonable priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel Anthony P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late july 2008, was in san diego for a conference, got a great deal online via hotel website was quoted 59.99/night. i was pleasently suprised with this hotel, very clean rooms a bit small with no frills, (but what do you expect for 59.99).Short walk to gaslamp district about 10 mins. One thing i enjoyed about this hotel is that it was indoors so i felt a lot safer would definenly stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaUmeaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed at this hotel in late March 2008. OK, the hotel is not a luxyry establishment, but is great value when it comes to location and price per night! The room was a nonsmoking room, clean and the staff very polite and helpful. They have parking just outside the door, which is free for hotel guets. You can buy brekfast in the small shop next doors. From this hotel it is vey easy to drive to Balboa Park, the zoo and Sea World. The Gaslight district is within walking distance! The only con is the closest quarters: It is a bit dark during the evenings, but we never felt uneasy. Also, ask to get a room *not* facing the highway. Otherwise, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Austate
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located in the downtown area. It is close to the Little Italy Quarter. It has ample parking. There is elevator access, laundry, and ice / vending machines. It has a nice view from the third floor. The room we stayed in needed just a little tender loving care. Nice atmosphere, but there was a little problem with the housekeeping department. The sheets and towels are not changed daily unless one asks for it to be changed. Always check to see if there is a problem with your belongings in the room.

Reviews.Title: “quite a surprise”
Reviews.Author: aon2020
Reviews.Content: Well i was quite surprised by this place- never stayed in a motel before and was nto overly keen as my knowledge of motels is pretty much based on american tv programmes like my name is earl and prison break so was not jumping for joy at my american friend's suggestion me and the boyfriend stay here for a couple of nights before we returned home (cash was v low after being to vegas!!) but well i should learn not to be such a snob - as the location was good - not right next to the gaslamp but in a quiet bit near the italian area and very safe. Room and bathroom tiny but only two nights here so not bothered. Had been told you get it cheaper if there is only one of you so the boy snuck in and out (to be fair dont think the staff cared) they booked us a taxi for the airport and there is a really great wee place for breakfast next door - takeaway with a couple of tables outside. Impressed with motels and wont discount in the future. I wouldnt recommend for more than a couple of nights though or you might kill your travelling companion - bed small and not much room to move. but when needs must it was just fine. Think it was $90 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much, but satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: IMRM
Reviews.Content: You get a room with a bed, a bathroom, a counter area with sink, a/c and a tv, and thats about it. its on the bottom of the scale, so expect that going in and you're fine. the staff was very nice to me & my wife. the parking is a small lot, but its free with your room. the place is secure at night; locking down with admission to the building by room keycard only. the look is of an old hotel that is now used by Motel 6, so dont expect a Hilton. bring your shampoo, blow dryer, iron if you need one; none of these are provided (read my first sentence). we stayed just one night, so we acceped the lower standards. more than one night: get a better place, by all means.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadSanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, this hotel is cheap for its location. It's close to downtown and the freeway. The room was small but otherwise clean. On the downside, I didn't really feel safe while staying here. On the first night, there was a girl passed out across the sidewalk entrance to the parking lot. On my last night there was a man begging for change in front of the elevator, /inside/ the hotel lobby. My room door had a sign saying "For your protection, when in the room use the security latch and deadbolt". I recommend you follow their advice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Motel 6 for almost one week in March 2007. We wanted something cheap, clean, respectable and close to major attractions. We got it all. PROs: - The location is excellent. Within walking distance to most tourist attractions. We walked to the gaslamp district, harbour, horton plaza, the park, and the main trolley station. - The price was unbeatable for the area/date of visit: $60 USD per night, booked through the hotel directly. - The hotel was very clean and tidy. Room cleaned each day. - The hotel was extemely basic: no hairdryer, no shampoo/conditioner, no coffeemaker in the room. Just room to sleep and put your luggage. - Local phone calls free. - Families and couples main clientele: respectable motel. CONs: - Only complaint I have is that the walls were SUPER THIN. You could hear your neighbour's conversations if they talked loud. But we called reception and they immediately rectified the problem. TIPS: The free morning coffees there are seriously horrible (free coffee/creamer not real cream or milk). But there's a Holiday Inn just around the corner on 1st street that sells MUCH better coffee with milk and creamer. It's literally 2 minutes a walk away and a much better option. I would definitely return to the same hotel if I wanted something in the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Motel 6 in December 2006. The hotel is in the financial district of San Diego. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the Gaslamp Quarter and Seaport Village. The neighbourhood is very safe and we walked pretty much everywhere. The front desk clerks were polite and helpful. The hotel offers free parking to guests. There are two large parking lots, so if the front one was full there was always plenty of room in the one to the rear. There is no breakfast available at the hotel, but complimentary coffee is available until 10am. All rooms have internal front doors. Access to the lobby is open past the front desk, but a key card is required to enter to building at night, or you have to see the night guard. The room was clean and functional. It was quite small, but not as small as other hotels we have stayed in. We booked online and paid no more than $73/night (the rate varied during our stay). The hotels nearer the Gaslamp were much more expensive. This is a pleasent hotel for the budget-minded traveller.

Reviews.Title: “If you can, go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: peacockphyllis
Reviews.Content: This was certainly not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but it was pretty close to the bottom of the barrel. We stayed for a couple of nights. I think we paid around $95/night. I didn't have any expectations of luxury accomodations from a Motel 6, but for the price I would have expected some of the basics which were lacking. Firstly, the location is both good and bad. It's convenient to a train stop and not far from downtown which was nice. It was also just across from the airport so you can hear planes landing all the time as well as next to another trainline which was extremely noisy. The view out of our window was of a little, trashy storage yard. The room we had could have used a good remodel. Stained carpeting, harsh flourescent lighting, hideously gaudy bedding, no door to close of the 'closet' ...everything just looked incredibly cheap. However, that said, the room did appear to be clean. My biggest complaints were the lack of really basic amenities. There was no clock in the room at all. There was no shampoo/conditioner in the room. When I called to get some, they made me walk across the parking lot at 11:00 at night to pick it up from the lobby. Only one very flat pillow per person and to echo another reviewer, the towels were like sandpaper. They could take the money they're investing in their satellite tv and put it into these things instead (who wants to sit in an unpleasant room and watch cable tv anyway?) I know it's just a Motel 6 and you get what you pay for, but I've stayed in a lot of hotel/motels of the same class/price that were a whole lot nicer. It's tolerable for a couple nights, but if you can afford to, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nek0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this summer on my road trip through California for a few days. The location was great, near Gaslamp Quarter, and a short drive to Seaworld and the Zoo. The rooms were a bit small, but clean. The staff was OK-friendly, helping us find a supermarket in the area. And they provide free parking, which is important!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: angelacharub
Reviews.Content: This Motel 6 is conveniently located and has clean, well kept motel rooms. I stress motel rooms becuase based on some of the other reviews, I think some people expect the ritz at $69 per night. This Motel 6, like most of the rest, is clean, well kept and is a cheap place to rest your head at night. The free parking is also a big plus in San Diego. There is also a great deli right next door which offers very good cheap breakfast and lunch options. They have a small courtyard inside the hotel which is very nice if you are traveling with a dog and want to take him/her out at night without having to go outside the hotel. The only drawback is that the other guests were less than considerate when walking in the corridors late at night, as they were very loud, but hey, like I said you get what you pay for and I expect these things when I want to stay somewhere cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the misfortune of staying at this motel, as nothing else was available. The Place stank as hell. Just as we had managed to get some clean air into it, the next day, some sort of house-keeping job caused the room to stink of the stale cigarette smoke all over again. Whew - hard to sleep when you keep smelling cigarette smoke all over. Never will venture into another Motel 6 ever.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people complain about....San diego with all of its parking issues can be a pain in the neck to begin with ..so that is why this motel is perfect.. its centrally located to the Gaslamp part of town .. its clean and very basic.. now I have stayed in many hotel/motels before and I would have to say my only complaint is their sandpaper bath towels...ASide from that its a clean safe place to rest your head for the night....all complainers need to take it for what it is...A MOTEL! I plan to continue to use MOTEL6 ^ Downtwn as my "go to " place to stay whenever visiting which is often..just bring your own towels!

Reviews.Title: “No bandaids”
Reviews.Author: aleryan
Reviews.Content: These were the smallest Motel 6 rooms I've ever been in. Our small window faced the bathoom of the home next door. My 10 month old son conked his head on the corner of a nightstand and the hotel clerks wouldn't even give me a bandaid. I didn't complain that he hit his head I just wanted a bandaid, but that wasn't allowed and couldn't be bought from the little vending machines in the laundry room either. Downtown is a horrid place to stay if there is a Paredes game. Don't even think about going to the gaslamp district in your own car because you'll just end up frustrated at the lack of parking. The nice things about the hotel were the price, Motel 6 offers a internet discount on their site. It is very close to everything, it's only 5 miles to seaworld which was the reason we made the trip. I really do like Motel 6 and always use them but next time I go to SD I think I'll try one of the other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Oomsie
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget, and want to stay downtown, this Motel 6 is a good choice. The location has you close to all downtown attractions and walking distance to the Gaslamp. It is located right off of I-5, so if you're a light sleeper, traffic noise may be an issue. The rooms are very small, but parking and local call are free (a rarity in SD hotels). We stayed here for one night in June. It was our first night in San Diego, and we knew we wouldn't be in the room much. The duration of our trip was going to be spent at a hotel in Mission Bay, so we opted for an inexpensive, clean room in downtown for the first night. For the price we paid, the accomodations seemed appropriate. Consider this hotel if you're on a budget or only need a place to sleep for the night. It's a typical Motel 6: no frills, but not overpriced either.

Reviews.Title: “Below average Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Catlover4
Reviews.Content: OK place to stay if you want an inexpensive room, but I would not stay again. Actually, we checked-out within 20 mins of arrival because a pipe had ruptured and the water was going to be off until late in the evening. (This was Memorial Day weekend 2004 and we had been on the road since 4:00 am) The room we were in was extremly small and the window's screen was torn along the bottom and half way up each side, and TV only had sound no picture, and I did not see any places to eat close by. Again, if you are on a tight budget or just want a place to sleep this is a fair place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: San_Franciscan_101
Reviews.Content: We lived here for two nights and it is great. Great location and nice room. Especially it is close to SD zoo and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “worth consideration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two midweek nights recently and was completely satisfied. Parking on-site is free and there are two small parking areas adjacent to the property that can be used, however one of them can be pretty tight to navigate when the lot is full... the other lot is set up a little better with regards to that. Rooms clean and functional. Nice little store next to the motel's front door... within walking distance of gaslamp and such. I'd certainly consider returning! Great option for a downtown stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 San Diego Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1546 2nd Avenue, I-5/San Diego Freeway at 6th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
